Perceived Common Law Marriage in a State That Does Not Recognize Common Law Marriages
In
VAOPGCPREC 58-1991
, the General Counsel held that if a surviving spouse believed they were party to a common law marriage with a Veteran in a State that does not recognize common law marriages, VA must determine whether or not the common law marriage may nevertheless be deemed valid under
38 CFR 3.52
.
